description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s First 100 Days and What’s Ahead on Tariffs and Taxes

description: French President Emmanuel Macron believes the US is open to ramping up sanctions against Russia after he urged Donald Trump last week to get tougher with Vladimir Putin, he said in a Paris Match interview released on Monday.
title: Macron Urges Trump To Take a Firmer Line With Putin Over Ukraine

description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is poised to secure what could be a large capital gains tax break. But to get it, he’ll have to lock in about $54 million in paper losses as the tariff policies he’s championed have hammered financial markets.
title: Howard Lutnick Wins Tax Break on Big Stakes Hit by Markets’ Slump

description: Pakistan’s defense minister warned of the possibility of war with India but said it can be averted, as tensions rise over last week’s militant attacks in the northern region of Kashmir that killed 26 people.
title: Pakistan Minister Warns of ‘Immediate Threat’ of War With India

description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s approval rating rose in April, halting a prolonged slide caused largely by soaring food prices that are angering voters.
title: Improving Brazil Outlook Halts Long Slide in Lula’s Popularity

description: President Claudia Sheinbaum is more admired by Mexicans than even her popular predecessor Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, a status that is fueling economic optimism despite risks of a recession and the perils of a US trade war.
title: Sheinbaum’s Popularity Passes AMLO’s, Feeding Mexican Economic Optimism

description: Ronen Bar, the chief of Israel’s Shin Bet internal security service, said Monday that he’ll step down on June 15, defusing a dispute with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, whose attempt to fire him was blocked by the Supreme Court.
title: Israel’s Shin Bet Head to Step Down After Dispute With Netanyahu

description: A few months ago, Canada’s Pierre Poilievre seemed to be cruising toward victory in the next election. His Conservative Party was polling around 20 percentage points ahead of Justin Trudeau’s Liberals because of growing voter frustration around political scandals and rising housing costs.
title: A Guide to Canada’s Election, Starring Donald Trump

description: New taxes passed in the final days of Washington’s legislative session seek to bridge a record budget deficit by shifting more of the tax burden to technology companies like Amazon.com and Microsoft Corp.
title: Washington State Tax Hikes Target Tech Giants That Made It Rich

description: Panama expects more cooperation with the US but is avoiding taking sides in a trade war between the world’s two largest economies, according to its finance chief.
title: Panama Seeks US Cooperation Without Taking Sides in Trade War

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez offered few answers and no concrete time frame for when the country’s power grid would be fully operational after suffering the worst outage in Europe in over a decade.
title: Sanchez Provides Few Answers on Spain’s Lingering Blackout

description: Fare evasion on New York City’s subways and buses continues to decline as the nation’s largest transit agency seeks to get more riders to pay for service.
title: New York City Transit System Chips Away at Subway Fare Evasion

description: President Donald Trump said he thinks embattled Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth will “get it together,” suggesting he’ll stick with his choice to lead the Pentagon despite recent turmoil.
title: Trump Predicts Hegseth Will ‘Get It Together’ Despite Controversies

description: Defense spending surged last year by the most since at least the end of the Cold War, according to data published Monday, with European countries rushing to bolster their security in the face of threats from Russia.
title: Global Military Spending Surges as Europe Tackles Russian Threat

description: The US is imposing sanctions on three vessels for allegedly delivering refined petroleum products to the Houthis, a sign of continued US pressure as it negotiates with Iran about Tehran’s nuclear program.
title: US Sanctions Three Ships Allegedly Linked to Iran-Backed Houthis

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and congressional Republicans will meet to sketch out the plan for passing a multi-trillion tax cut in the coming weeks as polling shows that voters largely disapprove of the White House’s handling of the economy.
title: Bessent, GOP Huddle on Taxes as Economic Tension Builds

description: New York City’s congestion pricing toll pulled in $159 million in the first three months of the program as the Trump administration is pushing to end the controversial initiative.
title: NYC’s Congestion Toll Raised $159 Million in the First Quarter

description: The US wants central and eastern European countries to join its path of “energy freedom” instead of following the wider region’s transition to a net zero economy, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said in Warsaw.
title: US Urges Eastern Europe to Split From EU Energy Transition Aims

description: Major emerging market nations are striving to turn the BRICS group into a global forum capable of addressing the economic and political chaos unleashed by Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: BRICS Seeks to Fill Void Left by G-20 as Trump’s Trade War Rages

description: President Donald Trump will sign a pair of executive orders the White House says will help law enforcement implement his sweeping deportation agenda by cracking down on places that restrict cooperation with immigration enforcement.
title: Trump Readies Orders Targeting Sanctuary Cities, Police Reforms

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said “all aspects” of the US government are in contact with China but that it’s up to Beijing to take the first step in de-escalating the tariff fight with the US due to the imbalance of trade between the two nations.
title: Bessent Says ‘It’s Up to China to De-Escalate’ in Trade War

description: International Business Machines Corp. plans to invest $150 billion in the US over the next five years, joining a cohort of companies that have announced spending commitments following President Donald Trump’s election and tariff threats.
title: IBM Plans to Invest $150 Billion in US Over Next Five Years

description: Talks between the UK and India on a free trade agreement have entered the final stretch, with both sides now wrangling over five unresolved issues, according to an official in New Delhi familiar with the matter.
title: India, UK Spar Over Key Issues as Trade Pact Nears Finish Line

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared a new temporary ceasefire in his war on Ukraine to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory in World War II, drawing criticism from the US as it seeks to negotiate a peace deal.
title: Putin Declares 72-Hour Ukraine Truce to Mark WWII Victory

description: Israel plans to make a major regulatory concession to Washington in a bid to get a better deal from President Donald Trump over tariffs, Economy and Industry Minister Nir Barkat said.
title: Israel Offers US Trade Concession in Effort to Avoid Tariff Pain

description: As tariffs spur worries of an economic downturn, Americans are poised to face higher costs with fewer resources to rely on.
title: Trump Cuts Threaten Americans’ Safety Net Just as More Are Expected to Need It

description: Donald Trump’s Russia policy has been sounding very familiar to the Kremlin.
title: Trump Tells Americans What Putin Wants Them to Hear

description: Boos, shouts and insults dominated New York Representative Mike Lawler’s rowdy town hall on Sunday as the GOP lawmaker’s constituents seethed over President Donald Trump and Republicans in Congress.
title: New Yorkers Boo and Jeer GOP’s Lawler at Circus-Like Town Hall

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Asia Forges Ahead of Europe in Trade Deal Push

description: The Philippines will seek to bring down its US tariff rate to zero from the 17% earlier announced by President Donald Trump during talks with officials in Washington, the Southeast Asian nation’s trade chief said.
title: Philippines Aims to Lower US Tariff to Zero During Talks

description: Hungary won’t reduce its economic ties with China, the nation’s minister of economy said, in the clearest sign yet that Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government won’t bow to US pressure to distance itself from Beijing.
title: Hungary Rejects US Pressure to Reduce Its Chinese Economic Ties

description: The Conservative Party chipped away at the lead held by Mark Carney’s Liberals in the final days of Canada’s election campaign, though surveys still point to a probable Liberal victory in Monday’s vote.
title: Carney’s Edge Slips as Canada’s Election Comes to a Hectic End

description: Germany’s Christian Democratic Union named two company executives as cabinet ministers to serve under conservative Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz, filling in key personnel with business experience as the new government faces pressure to revive growth.
title: Merz Taps Corporate Germany as New Cabinet Starts to Take Shape

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is facing a potential new conflict with the European Union over allegations that he bankrolled pro-government media in the country with over €1 billion ($1.1 billion) in state support.
title: Hungary’s Orban Gets EU Complaint in Billion-Euro Media Bankroll

description: Thailand will require foreign visitors to fill up a pre-departure digital form from May 1, a move that will make it easy for authorities to track travelers amid a broadening crackdown against human trafficking into Southeast Asia’s illegal cybercrime centers.
title: Tourism Hot Spot Thailand Launches Digital Arrival Card for Foreign Visitors

description: Lebanon may be able to sign a so-called staff-level agreement with the International Monetary Fund within months, according to its economy minister, a step that would pave the way for talks over a funding package for the war-ravaged nation.
title: Lebanon Hopes for Initial IMF Agreement Within Months

description: A Philippine national security official said China is “attempting to influence” its midterm elections after it declared sovereignty over an uninhabited reef in the South China Sea just ahead of next month’s polls.
title: Philippine Official Says China Trying to Influence Its Elections

description: If he bothered with evidence, he’d see institutions under attack and in need of US support.
title: JD Vance Owes Romania an Apology

description: Malaysia’s highest court allowed the Attorney General’s Chambers to pursue its appeal against former Prime Minister Najib Razak’s bid for house arrest, in a fresh blow for the jailed politician.
title: Malaysia’s Ex-PM Najib Hits Stumbling Block in House Arrest Bid

description: Shari Redstone wanted to know what 60 Minutes was going to say next about President Donald Trump.
title: Behind the ‘60 Minutes’ Upheaval, a Big Merger Seeking Approval

description: North Korea acknowledged for the first time that it deployed troops to support Russia’s war on Ukraine, claiming the country’s military had helped Moscow retake control of the border region of Kursk.
title: North Korea Confirms Troop Deployment to Russia for First Time

description: A global race to recruit US scientists is heating up as President Donald Trump’s sweeping cuts to research funding and federal agencies trigger an exodus from the country’s research institutions.
title: Global Race to Lure US Researchers Intensifies as Trump Slashes Science Funding

description: President Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught has roiled Washington and Wall Street for nearly a month. If the trade war persists, the next upheaval will hit much closer to home.
title: Trump’s China Tariffs Set to Unleash Supply Shock on US Economy

description: Some China-based firms hit hard by US tariffs are reaching out to Indian exporters to fill orders on their behalf and help them retain their American customers as they navigate a trade war causing seismic shocks in global commerce.
title: Chinese Firms Turn to Indian Exporters to Help Fill US Orders
